intro: Tetraplasandra meiandra var. molokaiensis, commonly known as the Moloka'i hibiscus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Moloka'i. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant features woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. It thrives in coastal habitats and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native range. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
